vague_description: Determine the optimal number of sandwich types to produce given ingredient constraints and profitability figures.
detailed_description: A breakfast joint makes two different sandwiches: a regular and a special. Both need eggs and bacon. Each regular sandwich requires \var{EggsReg} eggs and \var{BaconReg} slices of bacon. Each special sandwich requires \var{EggsSpec} eggs and \var{BaconSpec} slices of bacon. The joint has a total of \var{TotalEggs} eggs and \var{TotalBacon} slices of bacon. It makes a profit of \var{ProfitReg} per regular sandwich and a profit of \var{ProfitSpec} per special sandwich. How many of each sandwich should be made to maximize profit?
target_objective: Maximize the joint's profit from selling regular and special sandwiches
target_constraints: Number of regular sandwiches is an integer
Number of special sandwiches is an integer
Number of regular sandwiches is non-negative
Number of special sandwiches is non-negative
Eggs used for regular sandwiches and special sandwiches cannot exceed TotalEggs
Bacon used for regular sandwiches and special sandwiches cannot exceed TotalBacon
target_parameters: Number of eggs required for a regular sandwich
Number of eggs required for a special sandwich
Number of slices of bacon required for a regular sandwich
Number of slices of bacon required for a special sandwich
Total number of slices of bacon available
Profit from selling a regular sandwich
Profit from selling a special sandwich
